Award.AwardTitle: U.S. - China Workshop and Planning Visit on Sustainable Fuels and Clean Vehicles
Award.AbstractNarration:
This project will support a workshop on the topics of sustainable fuels and clean vehicles that will be held in conjunction with a planning visit to Zhejiang University and Shanghai Jiaotong University in China. The project aims at establishing new international collaboration in both research and education on sustainable fuels and clean vehicles. We face a critical challenge of transforming our current dependence on fossil-fuel-based energy to sustainable energy sources. The workshop provides an opportunity to bring together researchers from academia, national laboratories, and industries to exchange research experience and develop a coordinated strategy to increase competencies in transportation sustainability. The specific focus of the near- and long-term collaborative research programs will be in sustainability analyses of advanced biofuel transportation systems, biomass and biowaste for liquid fuel conversion, bioscience and engineering of biomass production, enabling technology for the utilization of alternative and renewable fuels in transportation vehicles, and advanced hybrid and clean vehicles.

This project will have an impact on realizing the maximum fuel economy, meeting the environmental constraints, and increasing the potential for utilizing bio-fuels in vehicles to ensure the timely achievement of energy security and emissions targets. The workshop and visit will lay the foundation for future collaborative research. The international engagement and collaboration on sustainable fuels and clean vehicles will advance sustainable energy solutions, which are adaptable to different locations with diverse climates and geopolitical structures. The planned collaboration will engage women and early career faculty members. The established international educational partnership will have a positive impact to the training of the next generation workforce in the U.S.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The program of U.S. - China Workshop and Planning Visit on Sustainable Fuels and Clean Vehicles at Michigan Technological University was funded by US National Science Foundation. The overall goal of the program is to catalyze research and educational partnerships between U.S. and China in the areas of sustainable fuels and clean vehicles. The program successfully organized a workshop on sustainable fuels and clean vehicles in China National Convention Center, Beijing, on July 4th, 2013 with the China Power & Clean Energy Expo China 2013 (CP & CEEC 2013) conference. Eight workshop speakers presented their research and education experience in battery safety and reliability for electric and hybrid electric vehicles, alternative fuels for spark-ignition engines, sustainability in algae biofuel production, biofuel environmental sustainability issues, advanced powertrain and engine control, international collaborations and student mobility, computer-aided engineering and next generation development of electric drive batteries, and model-based design and hardware-in-the-loop simulation for clean vehicles. The discuss sessions of the workshop provided opportunities for experts in US and China to exchange ideas on technological innovations, development challenges, international collaboration opportunities, and the development of coordinated strategy to increase US-China competencies in transportation sustainability.    

The program also supported four Professors at Michigan Technological University to visit two universities in China, Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Zhejiang University. Group visit provided opportunities for US Professors to learn and get familiar with sustainable fuels and clean vehicle research in China. From these two universities, additional connections were made to other major research institutions and universities in China in this area. The connections made through the workshop and group visit will allow research collaborations between US and Chinese experts in the areas of sustainable fuels and clean vehicles. Figure 5 shows Professor Yin at Shanghai Jiao Tong University who hosted our visit and introduced their research activities, laboratories, and developed electric bus to Michigan Tech Professors.
